Cell.Data: Anything between straight brackets - i.e. [ ] - is a formatting tag. Do not change these tags and keep them in the same relative position in the text. Anything between curly brackets - i.e. { } - is a place where text or numbers will be inserted by the game. Do not change the tag, but feel free to change its position in the text to suit the localized text.

In the text below, text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

In the text below, any inserted strings - anything of the form {text} - is replaced by an integer value for the thing described in the brackets. If the {text} is not followed by a unit - e.g. shields, hitpoints - the icon for the unit is inserted together with the integer. The same holds for symbols - e.g. '+', '%' - which are occasionally inserted together with the integer.
For references to game terminology and in-world references, please check the glossary delivered as part of the documentation.

Send a pulse of disruptive energy through target enemy Mechanical or Cyborg unit. Signal Shredding has a strength {ApplyStrength}[StrengthWave/] chance to apply [abilityred]Stunned[/abilityred] for {SignalTurn}[turn/]. If the stun fails, the unit receives [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred] instead, potentially staggering it.

Sometimes it is necessary to hard reset a computer, and Cyborgs are no exception. Removes all negative Status Effects from target friendly Cyborg unit. The effect can then jump to {numTargets} additional friendly targets within {hexDistance} hexes.
Supercharge target Mechanical or Cyborg unit, restoring all of its action points[movewalk/]. Units can only be supercharged once per turn.
This unit has been Accelerated and had its action points restored. This unit cannot be Accelerated again during this combat, or as long as it has this status effect.

Summon a Constrictor onto target hex during combat. The summoned unit lasts until the end of combat.[br/]The Constrictor is a Melee unit with strong incapacitating abilities that can disable other units and then deal tremendous damage.

Fire adhesive-containing shells at the targeted area that burst open just before impact and cover a {ArtilleryRadius} hex radius in an adhesive Biochemical foam, dealing {bioDamage}[DamageBio/] damage, with a {SlowChance}[StrengthPhysical/] strength chance to [abilityred]Slow[/abilityred] to the affected units for {ArtillerySlowTurns}[turn/].
Disables {amount} unit mod on all enemy units for {time}[turn/].

Reprocess one of your colonists to temporarily boost your production facilities. Removes {ReprocessColonist}[population/] and provides a {ReprocessProductionBoost}[production/] increase. This effect lasts for {ReprocessTurns}[turn/].
Your collectors have succesfully delivered the materials required for the repurposing to your production facilities, substantially increasing its production.

Assembly nanites assault the target army, retrieving valuable samples. Damages all units in the target army for {Damage} of their current [hp/], reduces all their resistances by {WeaknessAll} for this round and provides {ResearchAmount} for every unit damaged this way.
Units suffer {WeaknessAll} resistance to all damage for {duration}.
On failure, all units suffer {Damage} instead.
Your nanites have successfully retrieved several samples from their army. They should grant your scientists plenty of new insights while the enemy recovers from their wounds.
Your nanites faced strong resistance. Although they did not manage to retrieve any samples, they did manage to damage their targets.
Vile Assembly nanites assaulted your troops and ripped samples straight from their bones. Our forces suffered damage, and their scientists have gained insight about our units.
Vile Assembly nanites assaulted your troops and damaged them, but your soldiers made quick work of the pests before they could retrieve any samples.

By drawing static electricity from the air and channeling it all into a small target area, we can unleash a powerful [abilityred]Ion Storm[/abilityred], which reduces economic income and weakens any units in the sector. All Mechanical units in the targeted sector lose all of their [movewalk/].
On failure, all Mechanical units in the targeted sector lose all of their [movewalk/] but are not weakened.
We have succesfully managed to call down an Ion Storm in the target sector, rendering the area useless for exploitation and causing all Mechanical units to malfunction.
Defensive system in the target sector prevented us from creating the Ion Storm, but Mechanical units within the targeted sector were still affected.
A massive electrical discharge caused our Mechanical units to malfunction in the field and the resulting Ion Storm rendered the sector useless!
An electrical discharge was initiated in a sector! Our defenses managed to prevent it doing too much damage, but is still brought our Mechanical units to a halt.

Channel raw ionic energy into target friendly army. All Cyborg units lose {damage}[hp/] and gain [abilityblue]Ionic Overdrive[/abilityblue] for {duration}. Ionic Overdrive gives units [abilityBlue]Fast Movement Speed[/abilityBlue], causes their melee attacks to [abilityRed]Stun[/abilityRed] targets, and deal {damageBonusPercentage} extra damage.
We have successfully energized the cyborgs in the target army. There were some small explosions and minor damage, but the troops now stand ready, trembling with ionic power!

This unit has [abilityBlue]Fast Movement Speed[/abilityBlue], and its melee attacks deal {damageBonusPercentage} extra damage and have a strength {Chance} chance to [abilityRed]Stun[/abilityRed] targets.

The Assembly pick through the bodies of the dead, examining every nut, bolt and organ for their sinister research.[br/][br/]After winning Tactical Combat, gain {ResearchAmount}[research/] for each enemy unit killed, multiplied by their tier.[br/][br/]{HeroResearch}[research/] is gained from each enemy commander and hero defeated.
The assembly can see uses for things others would discard.[br/][br/]Rewards from clearing Structures on the World Map are increased.

Being part of the Reassambled, we have come to accept the fact of upgrading our bodies and augmenting them continuously. As a result of this continuous augmentation we can easily do so without any repercussions.[br/][br/]Modding units in the field no longer applies the Modded debuff.

Jack into the brains of your colonists to borrow spare processing power. They're probably not using it anyway...[br/][br/]All Colonists provide {ResearchProduced}[research/], but our Colonies suffer {HappinesLost}[anger/].

Our mastery of reassembly approaches completion. Nothing is wasted; everything has a purpose.[br/][br/]After winning Tactical Combat, gain {FoodAmount}[food/] and {ProductionAmount}[production/] for each enemy unit killed, multiplied by their tier.[br/][br/]{HeroFood}[food/] and {HeroProduction}[production/] is gained from each enemy commander and hero defeated.

Knowing that our troops can be assembled again and again upon their destruction increases their willingness to keep on fighting as their end eludes them.[br/][br/]Your Cyborg units gain {MoraleIncrease}[happiness/].[br/]After winning Tactical Combat, gain {EnergyAmount}[energy/] for each friendly Cyborg unit killed, multiplied by their tier.
